qas.question: What was one of the causes of the War of the Reunions?
When was the French annexation recognized by the Treaty of Ryswick?
What church was taken from the Lutherans and returned to the Catholics?
Who were the famous students that attended German Lutheran University?
In what year did the War of the Reunions start?
What nationality did the French fight in the War of the Reunions?
In what year did Goethe graduate from the German Lutheran University?
In what year did the Lutherans take possession of Strasbourg Cathedral?
What religion were most Germans during this time?

context: This <a0_0>annexation<a0_0/> was one of the direct causes of the brief and bloody War of the Reunions whose outcome left the French in possession. The French annexation was recognized by the Treaty of Ryswick (<a1_0><b6_0>1697<b6_0/><a1_0/>). The official policy of religious intolerance which drove most Protestants from France after the revocation of the Edict of Nantes in <b4_0><b7_0>1685<b7_0/><b4_0/> was not applied in Strasbourg and in Alsace, because both had a special status as a province à l'instar de l'étranger effectif (a kind of foreign province of the king of France). <a2_0>Strasbourg Cathedral<a2_0/>, however, was taken from the Lutherans to be returned to the <b8_0>Catholics<b8_0/> as the French authorities tried to promote Catholicism wherever they could (some other historic churches remained in Protestant hands). Its language also remained overwhelmingly <b5_0>German<b5_0/>: the German Lutheran university persisted until the French Revolution. Famous students included <a3_0>Goethe and Herder<a3_0/>.
